title: Harrow Viewpoint Walking Route

images.title: David Kemp / Harrow Weald Common, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Harrow Weald Common

images.title: Dudley Miles [CC BY-SA 3.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Harrow Weald Common pasture

images.title: Gme7 at English Wikipedia [Public domain], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Officers Mess Bentley

description: This walk visits the splendid Harrow Viewpoint in North London. From here you can pick up the London Loop and visit the adjacent Harrow Weald Common and the nearby Bentley Priory. Start the walk from Harrow Viewpoint car park on Old Redding Road. There's ample parking with fine views over North London to enjoy. From here you can pick up the London Loop footpath and follow it north to the common. Here you'll find woodland, heath and pasture with redwoods, rhododendrons and marsh plants like yellow iris and willow scrub. The path continues to Bentley Priory Nature Reserve where you'll find ancient woodland, grassland, scrub, wetland, streams and a lake. The grounds surround Bentley Priory, an eighteenth to nineteenth century stately home and deer park. To extend the walk you can continue along the London Loop to Aldenham Country Park where there's a nice path along the lake.
